sen.j: 壬申約条（じんしんやくじょう）とは、1512年（中宗 (朝鮮王)7年/永正9年）に李氏朝鮮から対馬国の宗氏に対して通告された来航者取締規則のこと。
sen.e: Jinshin Yakujo was rules for immigration that was issued by Yi Dynasty Korea against So clan in Tsushima Province in 1512.
Jinshin Yakujo were rules for immigration that were issued by Yi Dynasty Korea against So clan in Tsushima Province in 1512.
Jinshin Yakujo were rules for immigration that were issued by Yi Dynasty Korea against So clan in Tsushima Province in 1512.

sen.j: 1510年に発生した三浦の乱により、日本と朝鮮王朝との通交は断絶していた。
sen.e: The friendly relationship between Japan and Korean Dynasties had been severed due to the Sanpo disturbance in 1510.
The friendly relationship between Japan and Korean Dynasties had been severed due to the Sanpo disturbance in 1510.
The friendly relationship between Japan and Korean Dynasties had been severed due to the Sanpo disturbance in 1510.

sen.j: 通交再開の条件として朝鮮王朝側が一方的に突きつけたものが壬申約条である。
sen.e: The Jinshin Yakujo was imposed one-sidedly by the Korean Dynasties as a condition of resumption of the relationship.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Jinshin Yakujo was imposed one-sidedly by the Korean Dynasties as a condition for the resumption of the relationship.
The Jinshin Yakujo was imposed one-sidedly by the Korean Dynasties as a condition for the resumption of the relationship.

sen.j: 明治の日本の朝鮮進出後には永正条約との言い換えが為されたものの、条約としての体裁はない。
sen.e: Even though the name was changed to Eisho treaty after the Japanese invasion to Korea in the Meiji Period, it was still not in an appropriate form of a treaty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even though the name was changed to the Eisho treaty after the Japanese invasion to Korea during the Meiji Period, it was still not in an appropriate form of a treaty.
Even though the name was changed to the Eisho treaty after the Japanese invasion to Korea during the Meiji period, it was still not in an appropriate form of a treaty.

sen.j: 三浦の乱後、通交の断絶によって困窮した宗氏は大内義興を頼った。
sen.e: The So clan, suffering from dire poverty caused by the severance of friendly relations with Korean Dynasties as a result of the Sanpo disturbance, placed its reliance on Yoshioki OUCHI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The So clan, suffering from dire poverty caused by the severance of friendly relations with Korean Dynasties as a result of the Sanpo disturbance, placed its reliance on Yoshioki OUCHI.
The So clan, suffering from dire poverty caused by the severance of friendly relations with Korean Dynasties as a result of the Sanpo disturbance, placed its reliance on Yoshioki OUCHI.

sen.j: そして、義興が後見する室町幕府征夷大将軍足利義稙の使者として派遣された弸中の助力を得て通交再開の交渉を行った。
sen.e: With the help of Hochu, who was dispatched as an envoy of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, the Seii Taishogun of the Muromachi shogunate under the guardianship of Yoshioki, the So clan negotiated the resumption of the relationship with Korean Dynasties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With the help of Hochu, who was dispatched as an envoy of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, the Seii Taishogun of the Muromachi shogunate under the guardianship of Yoshioki, the So clan negotiated the resumption of the relationship with the Korean Dynasties.

With the help of Hochu, who was dispatched as an envoy of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, the seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) under the guardianship of Yoshioki, the So clan negotiated the resumption of the relationship with the Korean Dynasties.

sen.j: 壬申約条はその結果として通告されたものである。
sen.e: The Jinshin Yakujo was issued as a consequence of the negotiation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Jinshin Yakujo was issued as a consequence of the negotiation.
The Jinshin Yakujo was issued as a consequence of the negotiation.

sen.j: 恒居倭（三浦（塩浦・釜山浦・乃而浦（薺浦））に定住していた日本人）の廃止。
sen.e: Eliminating kokyowa (Japanese people who lived in Sanpo, namely, Enbo, Pusanpo and Naijiho or Seiho).
Eliminating kokyowa (Japanese people who lived in Sanpo, namely, Enbo, Pusanpo, and Naijiho or Seiho).
Eliminating kokyowa (Japanese people who lived in Sanpo, namely, Enbo, Pusanpo, and Naijiho or Seiho).

sen.j: 開港場を薺浦のみに制限。
sen.e: Limiting open port to Seiho (port of Sei) only.
Limiting the open port to Seiho (port of Sei) only.
Limiting the open port to Seiho (port of Sei) only.

sen.j: 島主歳遣船（宗氏本宗家が毎年遣わす使送船）を嘉吉条約における50隻から半分の25隻に削減。
sen.e: Reducing the number of toshu saikensen (ship of head family of So clan to dispatch an annual envoy to Korea) from fifty, which number was determined in the Kakitsu Treaty, to twenty-five.
Reducing the number of toshu saikensen (ships of head family of the So clan to dispatch an annual envoy to Korea) from fifty, which number was determined in the Kakitsu Treaty, to twenty-five.
Reducing the number of toshu saikensen (ships of head family of the So clan to dispatch an annual envoy to Korea) from fifty, which number was determined in the Kakitsu Treaty, to twenty-five.

sen.j: 宗氏有力庶家名義の歳遣船、特送船（緊急の報告のための遣船）、興利倭船の禁止。
sen.e: Banning saikensen (ship to dispatch an envoy to Korea) owned by powerful branch families of the So clan, tokusosen (ship to dispatch an envoy to Korea to deliver immediate report) and koriwasen (ship for trading with Korea).

Banning saikensen (ship to dispatch an envoy to Korea) owned by powerful branch families of the So clan, tokusosen (ship to dispatch an envoy to Korea to deliver immediate report), and koriwasen (ship for trading with Korea).

Banning saikensen (ship to dispatch an envoy to Korea) owned by powerful branch families of the So clan, tokusosen (ship to dispatch an envoy to Korea to deliver immediate report), and koriwasen (ship for trading with Korea).

sen.j: 李氏朝鮮から対馬・宗氏への歳賜米・歳賜豆を嘉吉条約の200石から半分の100石に削減する。
sen.e: Reducing the amount of sanshimai (rice given by Korea) and sanshito (beans given by Korea) given by Yi Dynasty Korea to the So clan in Tsushima from 200-koku (a unit of volume of rice: 1-koku is 180.39 liter), which amount was determined in the Kakitsu Treaty, to 100-koku.

Reducing the amount of sanshimai (rice given by Korea) and sanshito (beans given by Korea) given by the Yi Dynasty Korea to the So clan in Tsushima from 200-koku (a unit of volume of rice: 1-koku is 180.39 liters), which the amount was determined in the Kakitsu Treaty, to be 100-koku.

Reducing the amount of sanshimai (rice given by Korea) and sanshito (beans given by Korea) given by the Yi Dynasty Korea to the So clan in Tsushima from 200-koku (a unit of volume of rice: 1-koku is 180.39 liters), which the amount was determined in the Kakitsu Treaty, to be 100-koku.

sen.j: 受職人（李氏朝鮮から官職を授かった日本人）及び受図書人（「図書」と呼ばれる通交許可証を持つ日本人）に対する再審査を行い、実態の伴わない者の資格を剥奪してその人数を減らす。
sen.e: Reducing the number of Jushokunin (Japanese given Korean government post by Yi Dynasty Korea) and Jutoshonin (Japanese given Korean government evidence called 'Tosho' to be granted special privileges in trading) by reexamining them and disqualifying those who were in name but not in deed.

Reducing the number of Jushokunin (Japanese given Korean government post by the Yi Dynasty Korea) and Jutoshonin (Japanese given Korean government evidence called 'Tosho' to be granted special privileges in trading) by re-examining them and disqualifying those who were in name, but not in deed.

Reducing the number of Jushokunin (Japanese given Korean government post by the Yi Dynasty Korea) and Jutoshonin (Japanese given Korean government evidence called 'Tosho' to be granted special privileges in trading) by re-examining them and disqualifying those who were in name, but not in deed.
These are the main contents of the Jinshin Yakujo.
This is the main contents of the Jinshin Yakujo.
This is the main contents of the Jinshin Yakujo.

sen.j: 宗氏はこの要求に屈し、この規則に基づく関係は豊臣秀吉の朝鮮征伐まで継続されることになる。
sen.e: The So clan succumbed to these demands and the relationship with Korean Dynasties based on these rules lasted until Toyotomi Hideyoshi's Korean Invasions.
The So clan succumbed to these demands and the relationship with Korean Dynasties based on these rules lasted until Toyotomi Hideyoshi's Korean Invasions.
The So clan succumbed to these demands and the relationship with Korean Dynasties based on these rules lasted until Toyotomi Hideyoshi's Korean Invasions.
